headline: Review & Preview: Where Are the Bears?
summary: The stock market hit another small bump today, but not before the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite touched their highest intraday levels on record.  The S&P 500 closed down 0.3%, while the Nasdaq was off 0.1%.  Stocks got off to a strong start after PepsiCo and Delta Air Lines reported quarterly results (more on that below), but the earnings trickle wasn’t enough to boost the rest of the market.

summary: PepsiCo logged higher revenue in its fiscal third quarter, though profit slipped as volumes fell. The company also tapped a Walmart executive to fill its top finance role as PepsiCo aims to turn around its slowing soda and snack sales.

headline: Playing the beverage space: Why BofA's top stock pick isn't PepsiCo
summary: PepsiCo (PEP) is making big changes in some of its snack products in an effort to appeal to more health-conscious consumers. Bank of America Securities food and beverage analyst Peter Galbo joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton to discuss how to play the food and beverage space as shifting consumer attitudes are weighing on names like PepsiCo and Corona-maker Constellation Brands (STZ). Galbo also shares one stock in the space he has a Buy rating on. Check out Yahoo Finance's interviews with Constellation Brands CEO Bill Newlands and PepsiCo CEO Ramon Laguarta. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

Yahoo Finance Senior Consumer Reporter Brooke DiPalma outlines PepsiCo's four initiatives to revamp the snack business, as Senior Reporter Ines Ferré shares the consumer perspective on how the new offerings could better appeal to customers. Robinhood chief investment officer Stephanie Guild weighs in on what the change means for investors and the company's ongoing turnaround efforts. Read up on PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta's comments to Yahoo Finance about the brand's restructuring plan. headline: US stocks and gold, Fed rate cuts, Delta & PepsiCo: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are hovering near their flatlines in Thursday's premarket after the S&P 500 (^GSPC) and Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) rallied to record highs on Wednesday. Gold (GC=F) eyes $4,100 per ounce as it continues its own record run. The Federal Reserve's minutes from its September FOMC meeting revealed that officials are still willing to cut interest rates further in 2025. Shares of Delta Air Lines (DAL) and PepsiCo (PEP) are both up in extended hours after both companies beat third quarter earnings expectations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: PepsiCo Stock Rises After Earnings Beat and It Names New CFO. What to Know.
summary: PepsiCo  stock climbed after the snacks and beverage company reported slightly better-than-expected quarterly results and announced a new chief financial officer early Thursday.  Third-quarter adjusted earnings came in at $2.29 a share on sales of $23.9 billion.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected per-share earnings of $2.26 on sales of $23.8 billion.

Third-quarter adjusted earnings came in at $2.29 a share on sales of $23.9 billion.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected per-share earnings of $2.26 on sales of $23.8 billion.

headline: PepsiCo Posts Higher Revenue, Profit Falls
summary: PepsiCo  logged higher revenue in its fiscal third quarter, though profit slipped as volumes fell.  The Purchase, N.Y., snacks and soda maker on Thursday posted a profit of $2.6 billion, or $1.90 a share, for its quarter ended Sept. 6.  Revenue edged up 2.7% to $23.94 billion, topping Wall Street’s expectation of $23.83 billion.

raw.headline: PepsiCo Posts Higher Revenue, Profit Falls
raw.summary: PepsiCo  logged higher revenue in its fiscal third quarter, though profit slipped as volumes fell.  The Purchase, N.Y., snacks and soda maker on Thursday posted a profit of $2.6 billion, or $1.90 a share, for its quarter ended Sept. 6.  Revenue edged up 2.7% to $23.94 billion, topping Wall Street’s expectation of $23.83 billion.

headline: PepsiCo reports strong third quarter sales despite weakening demand in North America
summary: PepsiCo reported better-than-expected revenue in the third quarter despite weaker demand for its snacks and drinks in North America.  Revenue rose 2.6% to $23.94 billion in the July-September period.  In North America, PepsiCo said sales volumes for its Frito-Lay snacks and other foods fell 2% in the quarter while sales volumes for its beverages were down 3%.

raw.headline: PepsiCo reports strong third quarter sales despite weakening demand in North America
raw.summary: PepsiCo reported better-than-expected revenue in the third quarter despite weaker demand for its snacks and drinks in North America.  Revenue rose 2.6% to $23.94 billion in the July-September period.  In North America, PepsiCo said sales volumes for its Frito-Lay snacks and other foods fell 2% in the quarter while sales volumes for its beverages were down 3%.

headline: PepsiCo Announces New Chief Financial Officer
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) today named Steve Schmitt Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective November 10, 2025. Jamie Caulfield has decided to retire next year after a more than 30-year career with the company. Jamie will remain CFO until November 10, 2025, at which time he will assume an advisory role and assist with the transition through May 15, 2026.

Jamie will remain CFO until November 10, 2025, at which time he will assume an advisory role and assist with the transition through May 15, 2026.

headline: Wall Street hovers near all-time highs with solid performances from top-tier companies
summary: U.S. markets are little changed early Thursday morning but continue to hover near all-time highs as a couple of high-profile companies report quarterly earnings.  Futures for S&P 500, Nasdaq and the Dow Jones Industrial Average are virtually unchanged before the opening bell.  The S&P and Nasdaq both closed at record highs Wednesday.
